snippet: Turkish Airlines said it had started twice-weekly flights to Mogadishu, which because of civil war has not had passenger service from an international carrier in more than 20 years.
abstract: Turkish Airlines begins twice-weekly flights to Mogadishu, Somalia, which, because of civil war, has not had passenger service from an international carrier in more than 20 years.
lead_paragraph: Turkish Airlines said it had started twice-weekly flights to Mogadishu, which because of civil war has not had passenger service from an international carrier in more than 20 years.

headline.main: Somalia: First International Flight in 2 Decades Lands in Capital
headline.print_headline: Somalia: International Air Service Returns With Flight From Turkey
